results.title: RhoA and Rho-kinase inhibitors modulate cervical resistance: The possible role of RhoA/Rho-kinase signalling pathway in cervical ripening and contractility.
results.text_hl: Compounds with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-like action might be new drug candidates for preterm @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervicitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002575 @@@cervical@@@ ripening.

citations.NLM: Domokos D, Ducza E, Gáspár R. RhoA and Rho-kinase inhibitors modulate cervical resistance: The possible role of RhoA/Rho-kinase signalling pathway in cervical ripening and contractility. Eur J Pharmacol. 2019 Jan 15;843():27-33. PMID: 30445018

results.title: Effects of neonatal enzyme replacement therapy and simvastatin treatment on cervical spine disease in mucopolysaccharidosis I dogs.
results.text_hl: Effects of neonatal enzyme replacement therapy and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment on @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervicitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002575 @@@cervical spine disease@@@ in @DISEASE_Mucopolysaccharidosis_I @DISEASE_MESH:D008059 @@@mucopolysaccharidosis I@@@ @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@.

citations.NLM: Chiaro JA, O'Donnell P, Shore EM, Malhotra NR, Ponder KP, Haskins ME, Smith LJ. Effects of neonatal enzyme replacement therapy and simvastatin treatment on cervical spine disease in mucopolysaccharidosis I dogs. J Bone Miner Res. 2014 Dec;29(12):2610-7. PMID: 24898323

results.title: Lipophilic but not hydrophilic statins selectively induce cell death in gynaecological cancers expressing high levels of HMGCoA reductase
results.text_hl: Our results demonstrate that both @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@lovastatin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, but not @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@, selectively induced cell death in dose- and time-dependent manner in @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervicitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002575 @@@ovarian, endometrial and cervical cancers@@@.

citations.NLM: Kato S, Smalley S, Sadarangani A, Chen-Lin K, Oliva B, Brañes J, Carvajal J, Gejman R, Owen GI, Cuello M. Lipophilic but not hydrophilic statins selectively induce cell death in gynaecological cancers expressing high levels of HMGCoA reductase J Cell Mol Med. 2010 May;14(5):1180-93. PMID: 19432822
